website_summaries.verdict: The whole family can work together in this exciting adventure game.
pros: This game brings adventure to your living room as players try to collect treasures before escaping the sinking Forbidden Island
Children can learn strategy and teamwork as parents work with them to help everyone escape in time
Presents a challenge for adults as well as kids
cons: Younger children may need help when playing this game on their own

customer_reviews.title: This game is great and bought it because Pandemic is one of my ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is completely cooperative; either everyone wins or everyone loses. You are given a number of actions and you can spend those actions to move, gather artifacts, or save the island. This game is great and bought it because Pandemic is one of my favorite games. This is a much smaller game than Pandemic, uses similar game mechanisms, and was designed by the same person. Unfortunately for me, I played Forbidden Desert (the sequel to this game) and it was better than this one. This game is still quite good and could easily be used to get players into this style of game before introducing them to Pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: The StasTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Great light and fun cooperative game that still has a good amount of tension
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of gaming and actually started by playing Forbidden Desert. We liked it enough we wanted to buy the original, which is this one: Forbidden Island. I have heard people say Desert is better, but I don't agree. Desert has a fun location mechanic (similar to what is used in Targi) but overall I think Forbidden Island is a better game. The tension associated with the game pieces disappearing as the island sinks makes this more fun than Forbidden Desert in my opinion. It's also cheap and slightly simpler. I actually like both cooperative "Forbidden" games, but in my opinion, this one is a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Solved it. :(
customer_reviews.text: Our family does a game night most weeks and I got this thinking it would be fun to play. And it was. We played it 3 times (2 adults and 2 kids, 11 and 10) before we figured out how to win every time. Even the "more challenging" level is just more flooding, which, once solved, isn't much of a challenge. I was hoping for re-playability, but we've taken this one out of the rotation. Fun and interesting the first couple of times through, though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Marks

customer_reviews.title: Game night adventures
customer_reviews.text: Super fun game. We play with a group of adults on game night. I love how there is always some new twist on how the game plays out. We used dragon shields for the cards, we had a couple that looked like they wanted to start splitting- maybe its a quality issue? But since we added the shields its been working great. Its very hard to play on the hardest setting, we haven't been able to beat it yet. We have also played with more than recommended players and it makes game play much more difficult but interesting. If you play with more players, start with a lower difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme D.

customer_reviews.title: REALLY MAKES YOU NERVOUS!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun! This is one of many games we have bought after watching it on Tabletop. It is a little easier to play with 2 people and gets pretty hard when playing with 4 people, but it is fun no matter how many are playing. When you have to start flipping and losing areas, your heart really starts pumping and makes you sweat! It's amazing how such an innocent game will make you so nervous!! Everyone we have played this game has really liked it. It's not real difficult to understand how to play but if you have problems you can just watch the episode of Tabletop and see how it's played.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Rely on each other and don't get stranded....
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically pleasing board setup, the different player roles reminded me of Jumanji and that made this whole game super fun for me. We played twice, first game we got smashed. Second game we played alot smarter and were able to escape with the island crumbling in our wake. Really good time and make sure you read the rules and details because you want everyone on the same page strategy-wise. Use each others skills to the max and you might just make it out of their alive.
customer_reviews.author: Knightling

customer_reviews.title: Like Pandemic But Better
customer_reviews.text: Got this to play with our family at Christmas. We love that it is a cooperative game- we all win together or lose together. Very similar formula to Pandemic, which is another favorite of ours. I feel like Forbidden Island is far less complicated and faster play with less pieces, which mean easier clean up. I would recommend for ages 10 and up, or mature 8/9 year olds with good attention spans. Only thing that would make it better is if it were for 5 players instead of a max of 4.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Day

customer_reviews.title: Different and fun game to change things up
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game that is very different from a conventional board game. My family can get pretty competitive, so we got this one to change the tune around game time. It was actually quite enjoyable. It can be as easy or as difficult as you would like. Truly, you could play this game alone and just make moves with more than one player. A cool variation is to try and not discuss strategy every move, but let everyone make their own moves without others' input. Then you have to try to get on the same wavelength, and try to understand another's thoughts to accomplish the goal.
customer_reviews.author: Thinny J

customer_reviews.title: So fun!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this game!!! We opened it on a Friday and y Sunday had played it 5 times. My 8 year old even stops playing Pokémon to come play this game. I took the advice of another reviewer and set the game up myself one night to learn the rules and felt it made a big difference the first time we played. It’s fun and challenging no matter how many times you play it. My 7&8 year olds are already asking for Forbidden Island and Forbidden Air. I have nothing but good to say about this game and urge you to try it yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Giles

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable Diversion
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have played this a few times during COVID-19 shelter-at-home. The rules are a little complicated but not really hard as long as you pay attention to the directions the first couple times you play. I like the cooperative nature of play which is different from almost all other games: you play with your partner and against the game. That being said, we have beaten the game each time, twice at the "novice" level and once at the "normal" level. (There are also higher levels which we will attempt next). It just seems too easy to beat. Are we missing something in the rules?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cooperative family game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooperative family game. . .interesting for adults and kids. The teenager enjoys it as well. The artwork is lovely and the components are top notch. I am very happy with this purchase. After playing Forbidden Island several times we also bought Forbidden Desert. That game is great as well, but Forbidden Island is the easier of the two (if you have younger kids definitely start with Forbidden Island). Forbidden Desert ups the intensity, which could be a good or bad thing depending upon your personality. There is a lot of fun packed into this game!
customer_reviews.author: Book A. Day

customer_reviews.title: Great Co-Op game, good story line with good quality components.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience with such a co op game and I and my family loved it. The quality of the game pieces including cards, tiles and treasure pieces is good, though I wish the cards were a bit thicker for longer life. When I read some reviews saying that the game builds tension as it progresses, I did not believe it, but of yes! it does. There are several elements - sinking island tiles, rising water level, water rise cards, etc. that create a sense of urgency and despair as you see the escape route slowly sink away. I think this game should have good replay-ability.
customer_reviews.author: Ady

customer_reviews.title: New family favorite...
customer_reviews.text: I played this with my kids ranging in ages 9 to 13 and they all loved it. It has become a family favorite. Forbidden Island is easy to learn, fun to play, fairly challenging, and quick (30 minutes to and hour at most). The game pieces and cards are well made. My kids like the plastic treasure pieces. They also like the tin box the game is stored in. Very fun and playable again and again. We just ordered Forbidden Desert and Forbidden Sky since the kids liked this game so much. These games are also Mensa Select Game winners for quality, challenge, etc. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great game. It’s an interesting spin having to work ...
customer_reviews.text: Great game. It’s an interesting spin having to work cooperatively. I’d say it doesn’t have as much replay ability as other games button has enough to keep things interesting. it’s a great starter game either for new players, or “first game of the night” or even for those nights when you don’t feel like investing too much time. One game is about 30-45 min. I’m very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: quickly the family's favorite board game for 3+ people in this trap-in-house pandemic period
customer_reviews.text: i have a 10 year old boy. my wife does not like too competitive games. it's not easy to get something everyone enjoys, have fun, not too long and have enough intelligent challenges. this one fits the purpose perfectly. it works with 3 people or more, has different challenging levels, and is cooperative games to bring the family together instead of fight/compete with each other. the only 'negative' thing about it is, the rules are a little bit complicated. but typical for this kind of board games.
customer_reviews.author: Denis W.

customer_reviews.title: Light and fun co-op
customer_reviews.text: Great intro to cooperative gaming and/or the game designer Matt Leacock. If you already love Pandemic, this game will feel different enough to justify putting it in your collection. This game has a strong overlap with Forbidden Desert, but is generally simpler to learn and manage (Forbidden Island doesn't employ an equivalent of the desert sand element present in Forbidden Desert). As such, I often select this game for lighter game night introductions (vs. Pandemic or Forbidden Desert).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: So much crazy fun. You and your friends work together to escape the island before it sinks. There aren't enough games like this where you and other players work against the game itself. This one is fun because you all get special abilities to help and have to figure out how to work together. For every round of player action the island gets to fight back with flooding and catastrophes which is fun, but also I've lost about as many games as I've won. This is a really great way to learn to loose as a team which is an oddly great experience.
customer_reviews.author: JT Solace

customer_reviews.title: A complex game for non-complex game lovers
customer_reviews.text: I like simple board and card games. I don't get into the strategy and long-games like Catan and others. But this one I liked. It took a while to understand the rules, there are a lot. But I love playing collaboratively (and not competitively) and the game itself is different each time. Highly recommend for those of you who want to get into more complicated games but aren't sure where to start. Graphics and pieces are pretty, strategy is challenging but not difficult, and you don't have to spend 2 hours playing 1 game. You can finish a game in 30 minutes with 2-3 players, maybe a bit more with more players.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly in MI

customer_reviews.title: It's kinda like Pandemic. Only you're on a sinking island.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this game. It's simple, yet fun to play. I'm going to start traveling with this game. The rules aren't overly complicated and it's a fun co-op game as you're trying to work together to get off the sinking island. I keep starting at the easiest water level possible since I'm constantly introducing new people to the game. It helps during the first play through. I normally play with just 1 more person making 2 of us. I do think 3 to 4 would be the optimal group. Especially, if you plan on going harder. All the components are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this game. Buy this game now! Don't even hesitate! Absolutely one of my favorite games ever! I just bought this and we have played it about 12 times so far. The first couple games were the learning ones but by the end of the second we were hooked. I love that it is more strategy over "I win!" type of game. You really need team work to win the game. I love that every game is different. My fiance and I have really enjoyed playing this after dinner as a chance to have some non-technology time. Really has helped us bond and have some silly fun. It's tough finding fun 2 player games, but this one is a winner!!
customer_reviews.author: KayFave

customer_reviews.title: A fun intro to collaborative games
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic choice for game night! I'm new to the world of collaborative games like Pandemic, but Forbidden Island strikes a perfect balance by being just difficult enough for failure to be likely, while being a quick enough experience to retry immediately when you inevitably fail and the island sinks.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Schneble

customer_reviews.title: Work together, not against each other, on this game
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to keep the peace in your competitive household, this game is for you! I love this game. Instead of competing against each other, you work as a team to rescue the treasures from your sinking island. It is a great game for competitive folks like me and my husband. Sometimes by the end of Scrabble, the mood can turn sour! Lol. There are different house rules you can adopt and this game has high replay value. It's a lot of fun and great for a wide range of age groups.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Coop Play is a breath of fresh air for our ultra-competitive family
customer_reviews.text: Background: I had to quit playing my favorite game, Risk, with my kids. I couldn't play my game, because all the tears shed lead to me feeling guilty for taking out my kid, and it always ended up at them fighting amongst each other. Almost had to do the same with Monopoly. This Coop game though, is awesome. It forces everyone to work together, but still provides edge-of-your-seat action. It's a great game. Lots of intense action, simple and easy to learn, and it goes pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tatman

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to coop games
customer_reviews.text: This game is a great introduction to cooperative style games in my opinion. Simple game mechanics and objectives, easy to understand rules, but still fun because it makes you think out loud with your teammates as to the best strategy to win. It's very replayable because you set up the board random every time, and you can increase or decrease the difficulty to your liking and depending on the group of players you have. It's a great game to travel with because it's relatively compact and lightweight, and easy to introduce new players to. We will be playing again soon!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fun, thinking, cooperative strategy game
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's teachers had been encouraging the students to play this game during some free time at school and she loved it so much, she wanted to play it at home. We have played the game as a family at least 5 or 6 times already. We tend to be fairly competitive, so it is cool that this is a cooperative game--we all win or we all lose! Teammates have to communicate and strategize together. There are also options for making the game more challenging as we improve our skills. I see many rounds of this game in our future!
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Simple Game, Beauiful Artwork
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get more into cooperative board games and FI had a lot of positive reviews. The rules are very easy and the variety of characters adds replay value. It is similar to Catan in that the board changes with every game. Overall it is not too difficult, seems well suited for ages 6-10. My only major complaint is that the game almost comes down to one person coordinating everything. I would like to see more chaotic/ chance elements involved to keep players on their toes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Pawson

customer_reviews.title: A LOT of fun
customer_reviews.text: I have all three "Forbidden" games and this is my favorite. The challenge of trying to keep tiles from sinking while collecting artifacts is really cool. It's difficult but not terribly so, and my family is able to win more than lose. It was probably the easiest to quickly learn, likely because there's no ship parts or "wiring" or any of that like desert and sky. All three are a lot of fun, but if you're new to these games this on might be your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: gEm

customer_reviews.title: A fun family adventure!
customer_reviews.text: This game is one of my favorites. I love family friendly strategy games, and especially cooperative ones. I created interest in my son's by liking it to Indiana Jones, and really it does have that theme and tension so we can live it ourselves. It was easy to learn and hard to win. But not so hard we quit trying. The better you work as a team, the better you tend to do. Apart from overall comments, the artwork is very nice, and I appreciate the creative special powers each player has. I encourage you to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Dena C.

customer_reviews.title: so we love this game
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so we love this game, although a star is off for two reasons: 1. The ending is...not fulfilling. We changed it so just one person can win. 2. Learning it takes a bit. I suggest playing a round with a friend or two to learn how it goes, and then playing for real. It does get easier when you've already played it and have someone who hasn't. Just sort of 'throw them in' and they'll figure it out. There are cards to guide you. Also - I definitely recommend at least 8 and up for ages.
customer_reviews.author: Raspberry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooperative strategy game!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cooperative strategy game! My children (ages 7 - teenager) & I all enjoy it. It is challenging, even at the novice level, but not impossible. It is so nice to have a game that we can all enjoy! I am also impressed with the quality of the game pieces and packaging. The tin that holds all the game pieces seems durable and is reasonably compact. The tokens are plastic, but because they are a one piece design there shouldn't be any problems. The various cards feel as though they are plastic coated so they won't be too flimsy. I would certainly recommend this game and would purchase other games from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Onmymerryway

customer_reviews.title: Fun for couples
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love board games, but some just aren't fun with two people. We love this one! It's fun to work together and strategize aloud. This game goes pretty quickly for us - only about 30-45 minutes, with a quick setup and take down. Perfect for a fun, quiet evening after the baby goes to bed. There's a lot of variety in the single game, too - there are several different "roles" you can play, and ways to make it more "advanced" once you start getting good at it. We've played it three times since Christmas (and it's only NYE!).
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: No sore losers in this game
customer_reviews.text: Work together to defeat a game? Sounds like a nice way to get away from the competitive nature of a game like monopoly. It's interesting and it's fun. I like to play with people I'm dating to see how well we work together. It's fun to see how everyone strategizes, and it's not easy to defeat the game. The game play changes a lot, so you won't get bored after awhile. Roles can change, the board can change, and your strategy may change. And either everyone loses or everyone wins so you won't have someone rubbing it in your face that you lost against them.
customer_reviews.author: Tiegan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little game!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have an absolute blast playing this game! It is a cool little co-op game and we play it when we aren't feeling up to something more competitive. It is quite challenging, but very winnable. The only complaint I have (and I do mean the only complaint) is the tin that holds the game. It has a tendency to pop open at the worst times and spill the contents. That is fixable by wrapping a large rubber band around the container, but it better corrected by just placing the contents in resealable plastic bags and carrying them that way. This game is recommended for adults, but is quite easy to play with children as well. Play it!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift and we have really been enjoying it! I purchased it based on recommendations from Board Game Geek forums. The game and pieces are all well made, I like the graphics and the treasure pieces. The tin is very sturdy. We have played it with my 10 yr old, 9 yr old and 6 yr old (all separately) and we've done 2 players as well as 3 players. All of the kids were able to pick up the mechanics quickly and the tension of the island slowly flooding as you play is a novel thing for them. I'm glad we got this game!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel A

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a cooperative game that really feels like your in it to survive, together. I particularly like that player's characters are specialized and therefore you'll always have a different power than the others. It is this intriguing mix of skills and a doomsday timer that makes this game so much fun and have really good replay value. I've played with 7 year olds and up because they can always ask for help; it's part of the game! Nice production, graphics, game pieces. Just a winner at our house.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner's game for children and those new to cooperative ...
customer_reviews.text: Good beginner's game for children and those new to cooperative games. The packaging on this is perfect (love the tin) and the production value of the components, including the token and board pieces, is high. The only issue is that replay value is pretty low as once you've played it a couple times, it's time to graduate to Forbidden Desert and then to other more strategic cooperative games. (Try Pandemic if you're looking for a good one)
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great family game for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: My family loves this game! We played it and even the youngest enjoyed it. It's a great family game because you play as a team and you beat the game, not each other. It's a thinking game, for your older kiddos, and doesn't leave your younger kiddos crying. It's overall good for your relationships! :)
customer_reviews.author: Bee M

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad one to add for people who like boardgames
customer_reviews.text: This game isint bad with two players. Some games aren't well suited unless you have large groups. It's a little bit more complicated than average game to learn, but pretty unique and fun. The sinking and unsinking of tiles gets a little tedious. But worth adding to anyones collection. I think age 10 this might be a little complicated, unless they have played games before then its not a problem I suspect.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Simple But Surprisingly Hard
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have played this game numerous times as 2 players, and with my family as 4 players a few more times. We have yet to win the game yet, which isn't necessarily a problem. We've had a lot of fun playing, and seeing everyone work together (this is a cooperative style game) is really fun. The game was also pretty cheap, and the tiles, cards, and such were well made. I'd totally recommend this game!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan P.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great stradegy game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas for my ten year old son. It is challenging and fun to play as all players need to act together to win the game. It was interesting to see the different strategies that surfaced when we changed character roles during each game. It is challenging at first but it was easy enough for us to learn and grasp after playing 2 times. I highly recomend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Whitehill

customer_reviews.title: Takes two times to get the hang of it, then lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: The first time or two, we were constantly consulting the instructions, but then we were good to go. Our kids fight A LOT during competitive games. This game is good because all players are "on the same team" so to speak. We had a lot fewer fights and more enjoyable game play as a result. They still fought about who's character would actually get to rescue each treasure so we had to put away the figurines and just keep track on paper. Now we have a fun fight-free game.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin Kent

customer_reviews.title: this is one of the best games I have ever purchases
customer_reviews.text: I've played this seven times, and while I've won only 3 of those games I can say with 100% truthfulness, this is one of the best games I have ever purchases. Getting to play cooperatively to try to beat the island leads to so much fun and discussion and banter between all the people I have played with. Everyone can contribute and weigh in on the strategy, but ultimately it is the luck of the draw that can determine the outcome of this game. UPDATE: Bought one for my nephew! He loved it so much! He's smart kid and a good strategist, so far the only person I've played and made it off the island with. TWICE!
customer_reviews.author: YodaKnows

customer_reviews.title: Easy to teach
customer_reviews.text: I like the desert one the best, the boys in my house like the sky one the best, but we probably play this one the most. I feel like this one is super easy to teach to people, we just start playing and I find we only need to help people their first couple of turns. We used to always win, but then we kicked up the difficulty and now we find that the game can be super mean! lol. We love this game
customer_reviews.author: sillysam

customer_reviews.title: whole family enjoys it, easy to learn & take with you
customer_reviews.text: This comes in a nice tin that makes it easy to carry from place to place. The game itself is different every time you play but at the same time very easy to learn. My entire family enjoys this game, even the non gamers. As a cooperative game it is enjoyed by the non-competitive part of the family as well. You can also adjust the difficulty as you get used to playing so it becomes more challenging to win.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Very fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun and easy to set up and play. If you've played Pandemic (I had, and that's why I was interested in this game), it'll be a familiar feeling. It's a cooperative game that requires all players to play together in order to escape the island. It's a quick play (maybe 20 minutes or so) and very easy to learn for the first time. I'd highly recommend to families and friends who would enjoy playing and winning together!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Marchuk

customer_reviews.title: Fun with the kids
customer_reviews.text: I have two boys aged 12 and 8. We play this together quite often. It doesn't take a long time to play so we can get two or three rounds in after school, no problem. It's fun for adults as well as the difficulty is scalable to whatever challenge you're looking for. I actually have a good time playing it. Also, since it's co-op there's no fighting and bickering. We either all win or all lose. I can leave the competitive stuff to Smash Bros.
customer_reviews.author: Steelblade

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: My family and I can’t get enough of this game! We have played several times and have only won once. It has kept us on the edge of our seats. I like that the game tiles change with every game, which keeps it new and interesting. Those saying it is super easy must be playing it wrong. The tiles sink so fast that it’s hard to keep up with them unless you are a Pilot or Engineer. Many times it comes down to chance and whether you draw the right cards or not.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Everyone I have played this game with has loved it. I had one friend that went out ...
customer_reviews.text: Everyone I have played this game with has loved it. I had one friend that went out and bought it for herself right after she learned to play it with me. It is nice to have a game where you are working together to win I stead of against each other. So far we haven't lost a Game but we also always seem to have a new player with us that is just learning so we start at a lower difficulty level for them to learn. I also like that the board layout changes each game.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Fun, light cooperative game!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game that my wife and I play in our board game rotation when we stay in for date night. It's requires relatively little time for setup and our games last usually less than 30min. For a two player game, I think the difficulty is slightly increased as we must be mindful to make sure important tiles are unflooded. So far, we've lost more games than we have won, but we still enjoy playing it because it's light a game and more importantly, a cooperative experience so we either win or lose as a team!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty level variable is nice
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! While it was stressful at first to make it safely off the island before it sank into the abyss, we've gotten better. Fortunately, you can ramp up the difficulty level so it stays challenging and interesting no matter who is over for game night. If you've played the famous "Pandemic," you understand the gist of how this game operates (because it was designed by the same person). Hope that's helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Solumadur

customer_reviews.title: Great value, awesome game I give it 6 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game. For once a game doesn’t have just one winner. You either all win or all lose. Also every turn you talk about what are the best moves to make. It keeps everyone engaged in the game the entire time not just your turn. My 16yr old nieces actually stayed off their phones during the entire game! I can’t believe the low price for the game you get, could easily be a $25 game.
customer_reviews.author: Page

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, fun and cooperative
customer_reviews.text: This game is great for new board game players because it's pretty easy to learn the rules and involves cooperative play, so you don't have to worry about getting stomped by more experienced and/or troll-y players. Essentially it involves 2-4 explorers, each with special abilities, as they attempt to collect treasure on a sinking island and escape before it sinks completely. Every decision is done collaboratively and you can scale the difficulty based on your experience level. In my experience, every game I've played has been very close, and we generally win just in time. This leads to a fun game every time, and is a testament to how well-balanced the game is.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Family friendly
customer_reviews.text: Once you get past the learning curve this game is really fun!! We play with our 10 year old daughter and she loves it! This is the perfect game to teach her how to think ahead, through everyone's turn, during game play. It's also nice that everyone is on the same team.
customer_reviews.author: channing stone

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a 15 year old family member for Christmas, intending it to be just a fun game that we could all enjoy, unplugged and away from our phones. After a few rounds of play, her dad pointed out that from a parent's perspective this is a great game because it encourages players to work together to solve problems. That's the kind of lesson that's good at any age. It's easy to play, quick to learn, only has a few pages of instructions and comes in a nice little tin that is easy for kids to take to a sleepover or camp and for adults to take to a bar or patio.
customer_reviews.author: longhorn1114

customer_reviews.title: Gateway drug to co-op games!
customer_reviews.text: Are you intimidated by Pandemic? Or maybe you love it but sometimes want a faster version? Or your friends think it’s too nerdy and won’t play it with you? Forbidden Island is a fast and fun intro to co-op games! Also... compact tin means it travels well
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Haschke

customer_reviews.title: We played 4 times in a row
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is woohoo much fun! Idk if it was just me but the game got a bit intense at some points. It was nice to get to work together with my mom and strategize together instead of competing. Gorgeous artwork too. After playing 4 times in a row -about 2 hrs- I just sat and went through all the cards looking at the artwork. Super fun.
customer_reviews.author: Dwarfer 169

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to start playing more games together as a family, but were looking for something other than the traditional board games where its everyone against everyone. My company hosts a monthly board games and brews event, and one of my co-workers brought this which I played with him and a few other co-workers, so I picked it up on a lightning deal this black friday. Its a great addition to our other games and one in which we can play cooperatively instead of against each other.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Intro to Pandemic?
customer_reviews.text: It uses a lot of the same co-operative mechanics, but is simpler, less fiddly and easy to grab-and-go. As a game for new gamers, I like it a lot. As something to power-game....well it lacks enough depth for that. Horses for courses.....highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darbonzo

customer_reviews.title: A fun cooperative board game
customer_reviews.text: We really like this because our family of four works together to win. Seems rare in board games that you aren't all opposing one another or in adversarial teams. You are working "against the clock" which you can accelerate after getting used to the game to make it as challenging as you wish. Nice looking board and pieces with great mix of turn-based action, resource constraints, and collaboration.
customer_reviews.author: Nick85NY

customer_reviews.title: A keeper
customer_reviews.text: Tired of playing against each other? This game is a cooperative game, not too complicated, very fun and satisfying. I wasn't sure my group would like it as we've never played a cooperative game before but they liked it and we have a great time playing. The game is not long and leaves time to play another game during our limited time at the gaming table. Definitely recommend if you're on the fence about this type of game. Like the metal box as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dinsdale

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great family game, even our seven year old ones to play it. It is just as fun with two players or four which is a rarity among board games. It is a cooperative game so it's great to play with people that have a hard time losing, or help teach them too enjoy a game winning or losing. It is a bit on the easy side, however. There is little difference in strategy, with some of the players making the game even easier.
customer_reviews.author: vin

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: Easy learning curve; fairly quick game play; great for small groups. We thoroughly enjoyed this game. I prefer the group win/lose type of game rather than cut-throat winner-takes-all scenario. Makes for a much more sociable evening when we can learn to work together and just have fun. Ordering Forbidden Desert and Sky next.
customer_reviews.author: Chrysta

customer_reviews.title: Great game - love the team work and cooperation aspects
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. I bought this for my 9 year old daughter and I love the cooperative aspects of the game. It teaches the players to work together, using each persons strengths, towards a common goal. It also teaches strategy through the prioritization and sequencing of different actions. I actually wish there was a more corporate version I can use with my team at work.
customer_reviews.author: woodsy

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching cooperation and strategy
customer_reviews.text: We started playing this with our 5 year old and it has quickly become her favorite game. She has started to catch on to the strategy, which is what we were hoping to develop and teach her. It is a cooperative game which builds teamwork for and good sportsmanship. We try to have a family game night each week and this has quickly become a favorite and is in a weekly staple in our house.
customer_reviews.author: MommaLazer

customer_reviews.title: One of our New Favorites
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed this game a lot more than we thought we would. The theme of the game is so much fun and reflects in the game mechanics really well. I also love that there are different difficulty settings for newbies and experts. We found a ton of rule variants online (including a solo-version) that are SUPER fun, involving different island set-ups and flavor rules. This game is such a hit that we're already planning to order Forbidden Desert, the second game in the series. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old son and I have a lot of time together and we needed more board games. This game is awesome. It's a unique concept. Each game requires a different collaborative strategy. We've played with another adult too and had a great time with 3-players. Adults will have a good time with this game too.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Package

customer_reviews.title: An Easier Version of Pandemic
customer_reviews.text: I like Forbidden Island, but it's similar to Pandemic in terms of how to play. Very easy game. Too easy. We're spoiled by Pandemic. We've played Forbidden Island once and haven't pulled it out since. I'm wondering if the expansion pack will make it more fun. Hesitant to purchase anything additional when the hype for Forbidden Island is semi-nonexistent for the BF, though... I feel like Forbidden Island is a better game to play with kids. If you're looking for the adult version of this, grab Pandemic instead.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Krannich

customer_reviews.title: My family and I loved this game
customer_reviews.text: My family and I loved this game. The rules are easy to learn and the cooperative play style makes it so even my 3 year old can join in. It does involve some strategy as well so it is also fun for adults. My only complaint is with Amazon shipping. The game comes in a nice tin box which arrived dented despite there being no damage to the outside packaging - meaning that the game was damaged before being placed into the box for shipping. I like keeping my games in great condition so I did not appreciate it arriving damaged. If you like the cooperative nature of the game you may also enjoy forbidden desert and pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun cooperative game. Reminds me of pandemic in some ways but the strategy for both games is different. However it seems to be designed such that you can only win it with certain combinations of 'advenrurers'. I would recommend it nonetheless since it is still quite entertaining and fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: A&P

customer_reviews.title: Overall fun and interesting
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old for Christmas. It had a little bit of a learning curve as most games like this do. I feel like it would be better if you have 3-4 players. We have only done 2 player games. Both times we felt like we were playing in circles. Fun, but frustrating as a two player game.
customer_reviews.author: shoplove

customer_reviews.title: A simpler version of Pandemic
customer_reviews.text: If you played Pandemic, this is essentially a simpler version of it, quicker and smaller. If you have not played Pandemic, try it. It's good.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Good game for small groups
customer_reviews.text: We like Forbidden Island. It is a fun game with fairly quick game game play. most of our games have been 15 to 40 mins. I like that the game is different every time you play, and you get to work together versus working individually. We bought this game as a birthday gift for a friend because we like it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Medlock

customer_reviews.title: Too easy
customer_reviews.text: We've never lost a game, even on the hardest difficulty. We've played maybe 10 times. I'm fine with winning a lot, but all the time is no fun.
customer_reviews.author: Erik R. Johnsen

customer_reviews.title: Gateway to Co-Op gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is a great intro to cooperative board gaming. It was simple enough that my wife who's new to board games was able to pick it up and actually contribute to our strategy from even our first demo game. We definitely felt the stress as the waters began to rise! I cant wait to play it again, let alone on a higher difficulty! When the family gets more comfortable with the different roles and with "the board" having its own turn, we're going to plunge into something more complex, like Pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We had lots of fun with our 7yr old and 9yr old boys!
customer_reviews.text: Good team fun. I bought this because my boy where always fighting with each other during Monopoly and other competitive games. I needed a good team game to bring the family back together. This did the trick. We have fun working together to try and get off the island. Not the easiest to get started but once you know it it's lots of fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: CCCN Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Great cooperative game
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good party or family game this is it. We have loved trying to win the game with this cooperative game. It is simple to learn and even younger kids have a good time figuring out how to not drown on the island. It comes in a tin case and the pieces are all well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jennilyn Rock

customer_reviews.title: Fun cooperative game
customer_reviews.text: It's fun, it's exciting, it's pretty. My husband is more of a gamer nerd than I am, and he was bored by it at first. He felt like the mechanics were too easy to beat. After we set it "Legendary" mode, we died in the third turn, so he's changed his tune. It's so pretty, and I enjoyed it a lot, even though I'm not much of a gamer. I can't wait for my kids to be old enough to play it with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S

customer_reviews.title: hope you survive !
customer_reviews.text: This game is tense and a lot of fun love the co op work together to survive theme and the rules are easy for non gamers to get pretty quickly. Good gateway game for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to its reputation as an awesome 'gateway' board game. Great gameplay, varied strategies to win, adjustable player count, difficulty, and island layouts, combined with high-quality and unique components all make for a winning game. Even the box is nice; the photo doesn't show it, but the art has a nice embossed effect going on. I got Forbidden Desert before this, and although I like Desert marginally better, I heartily recommend both games. Island can be less forgiving, but with so many ways to alter or mitigate the challenge (and so many ways to play), you're bound to find something you like in here. I recommend trying it out!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Easy game that doesn’t take a long time each time
customer_reviews.text: My son played this at a friend’s house and immediately asked for his own. He still plays it at 11! I think it’s more appropriate for younger kids. It’s really easy to learn and doesn’t require a lot of thinking to play. I think he still plays with it because it’s more relaxing than some of his other games.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Teenagers working together??
customer_reviews.text: This game was SO fun! After watching an episode of TableTop, we bought this game for our family for Christmas! We couldn't wait to give it a try! It's a cooperative game so everyone wins or everyone loses together. You're playing against the game forcing my teenagers to work together as a family to rescue us off the Forbidden Island. The win is awesome and even the loss invokes discussion about what we could have done better. It's nice to have a game where no one is gloating.
customer_reviews.author: megan1230

customer_reviews.title: Fun and great for couples
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are super competitive, so playing board games can be really hard. However, with something like this where you have to collaborate with others to win, it's a win-win situation. We can play a game without getting (okay, ME getting) hot and bothered about it.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Simple - and Challenging. Allows All Playing to Win Together
customer_reviews.text: This fun game lets everyone play and strategize together to win. It can be challenging, and you CAN lose, but it provides a way to head toward a victory with everyone involved with each other instead of against. Also fun for just two players; my wife and I break it out occasionally for just us.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Groves

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: The fun thing about this game is you can pick what level of difficulty you play. Starting off we played on the easiest level. It was good for learning how to play but too easy for regular play. The 2nd time we played we moved up a level and enjoyed the game even more.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great entry into Co-Op board games!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our go to games in our house. A couple things that I will bring up that are really important to us: This game REALLY encourages communication. Perhaps a great ice breaker game for that date night? This game scales difficulty quite nicely. You can make this as easy or difficult as you'd like. This game was the first venture into cooperative board games for my wife and I, and we even just played it last night, that's how much this is one of our go to games. Great entry into the world of co-op board games!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Sampson

customer_reviews.title: A great, accessible strategy experience
customer_reviews.text: A great, accessible strategy experience. The count-down mechanic of the rising waters is an exciting motivator, and the game pieces are fun and evocative. There are some balancing issues though; some of the character roles are not useful, and sometimes the random placement of tiles makes the game very manageable and easy. However, these quibbles don't distract from the great flow and strategic thinking overall. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J Morgenroth

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play with just my husband and I
customer_reviews.text: Great game to play with just my husband and I. I love how you work to beat the game, and you are playing with each other, not against each other! Lots of fun! I wish the game lasted a bit longer....takes about 20 minutes before you know if you will win or not, and then another 10 minutes and it is over! Are there any extensions to the game?
customer_reviews.author: lauren salzman

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game, even with 2 people
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game, even with 2 people. I love that the difficulty changes depending on which character you draw and which water level you start on. It took my husband and I about 20-30 min to finish a game so it’s perfect for spending a little time together after our baby goes to bed without being up late. I also love that it’s a cooperative game so there isn’t any real competition. The instructions seem intimidating but it’s easy to learn and a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: KateKay

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for games that worked well for two people. This did not disappoint. The cooperative aspect is a lot of fun and the games are just the right length, about 20 minutes. What I love the best is the re-playability. The type of job you have, the board construction, and the surprise setbacks change every game so no two games will be the same. And it's a really great price! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A.N.B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Fast play
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun and fast game! My husband loves strategy based games and this one is easy for us to get out and play with company. Hasd a great concept and pretty cool little figures and graphics. Will definitely be fun to play with our kids as they get older too- great for problem solving and team work as this is a You versus the Board style game. Still not as cool or challenging as Pandemic (which is the same style of you versus the board, and I highly recommend buying) but still fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nail

customer_reviews.title: ... design and quality of the game pieces are very good. The game cards and tiles look like they ...
customer_reviews.text: The design and quality of the game pieces are very good. The game cards and tiles look like they can withstand abuse, and the tin box which the game comes in makes for very practical and nice storage. The game is relatively straightforward, and the fact that players have to cooperate in order to win is a refreshing concept. That being said, after playing a few rounds, I had the impression that this game would be best suited to a gamer group that includes a few children/young teens in it. Otherwise, in an all adult group, after the first/second playthrough, the challenges posed by the game could feel a little lackluster.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! It's great for family game night because it doesn't require much reading for my younger kids, and you work together as a team, so there are no hard feelings or competition. We have found that Forbidden Desert is a fun one too, but a lot harder to win. Forbidden Island is a lot easier to get through, but still challenging enough.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Add Forbidden Island to your game collection!
customer_reviews.text: Fun fun fun! Easy to understand co-op game that we can play over and over. Tensions rise as the waters do! Those special abilities each character has sure come in handy, IF you work together and use them wisely! If not, all of you will sink into the abyss along with Forbidden Island! High quality components in a gorgeous tin container is a great presentation and solid for storage. You will love this game!
customer_reviews.author: DavidR

customer_reviews.title: great quick game
customer_reviews.text: bought this before a vacation that was just my husband & I. the box is small & portable. set up was very easy & we played right on the bed in our hotel. we learned very quickly. have played a lot with friends back at home as well. definitely works with 2, 3, or 4 players very well.
customer_reviews.author: Saturn Ascends

customer_reviews.title: We got bored with it fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play with my husband, 10-year-old, and 8-year-old. Everyone caught on pretty quickly. The board game is made well with quality materials. It is definitely unlike any other board game we own. Unfortunately, after playing 3 times we got bored with it and now never play it.
customer_reviews.author: Msm

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and challenging
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have many board games, but we come back to this one most often. For being so simple, it is a surprisingly fun game. Also can be pretty challenging for two seemingly intelligent people. If you like cooperative two player games, this one's a must.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fun game to play with the family or friends
customer_reviews.text: We learned how to play this game at a game cafe so we bought it. This game is a lot of fun because you have to work together and not independently to win the game. So you all either win or you all lose. Great way to get people to work together.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Byler

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Easy to learn. Varied play. Lots of potential for long term enjoyment by setting the water level higher (difficulty setting). For beginners, recommend starting 2-player with the Diver and Pilot until you get the hang of the game mechanics, as those are the strongest characters in the game. UPDATE: played it about 10 times so far. Beat it on second highest difficulty level twice. I'd recommend one character tweak: permit the Navigator to move him/herself OR others 2 spaces for one turn. Makes little sense than the navigator can't take advantage of his/her own power, right? Also makes the Navigator worth playing. As is, weakest of the six, not worth playing.
customer_reviews.author: Granfallooner

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging game
customer_reviews.text: Fun, challenging game. The sinking mechanism makes provides a good timer while also providing a challenge, limiting how long the game can last, and the randomness of the board and variety of pieces, each with their own special ability, makes the game different and fun every time. Also, by playing cooperatively, everyone gets to work together and help out, rather than play for themselves alone. And both my nieces love the treasures.
customer_reviews.author: okapian

customer_reviews.title: It's sweeter when it's forbidden
customer_reviews.text: Gateway drug for another game. Forbidden island is a fun cooperative game. the rules are extremely simple and easy to learn. the game's difficulty and complexity are mostly random, though you can start out at a higher difficult by adjusting your handicap (flood level, and thus flood cards you have to draw) from the start, the complexity changes based on the randomly placed board tiles. Once you get the basics of this game down, you'll be hungry for something more complex. I immediately turned to Pandemic, which i've had a very difficult time putting down. This is still a very fast game to play and is great when you want to introduce new people into the cooperative board game world.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Walker

product_meta.title: Forbidden Island – The Cooperative Strategy Survival Island Board Game
product_meta.description:
Dare to discover Forbidden Island! Join a team of fearless adventurers on a do-or-die mission to capture four sacred treasures from the ruins of this perilous paradise. Your team will have to work together and make some pulse-pounding maneuvers, as the island will sink beneath every step! Race to collect the treasures and make a triumphant escape before you are swallowed into the watery abyss! The latest creation by cooperative game master, Matt Leacock who created the best seller Pandemic.

AMAZON.COM




You and your team can be the first to breach the borders of the Archeans' ancient mystical empire in the collaborative card game Forbidden Island, by Gamewright. In this game, teamwork proves essential to locate the Earth Stone, the Statue of the Wind, the Crystal of Fire, and the Ocean's Chalice as the Island floods beneath your feet. Adventure... if you dare!





MEGA T-REX

 * Ages: Ten and up
 * Requires: Two to four players


AT A GLANCE:

 * Be the first team to breach the borders of the Archeans' ancient mystical empire
 * Locate the Earth Stone, the Statue of the Wind, the Crystal of Fire, and the Ocean's Chalice before the Island sinks
 * Find the treasures through collaborative play and teamwork
 * Stimulates problem-solving and strategic skills






Breach the borders of the Archean empire to locate the four sacred elements. View larger. 



Work collaboratively with two to four players to locate the treasure.
View larger. 

THE LEGEND OF THE ARCHEANS
This game is centered on the legend of the Archean empire, a civilization that possessed the ability to control the Earth's core elements--fire, wind, water, and earth--through four sacred treasures. These treasures stayed hidden from enemies for years on the Forbidden Island, which was designed to sink if intruders ever attempted to capture them. Set the appropriate water level for your gaming skill, and let the adventures begin!

CAPTURE THE FOUR SACRED TREASURES BEFORE THE ISLAND SINKS!
Your team of adventurers must work together to keep the Forbidden Island from sinking as you seek the four treasures hidden within. The mission is carried out using different combinations of Flood, Treasure, and Adventurer Cards on the 24 tiles that make up the Forbidden Island. Once you've captured each treasure using the appropriate cards, you must make it to Fools' Landing and escape by helicopter in order to win. If the island sinks before you complete your tasks, the mission ends in defeat.

USE COLLABORATIVE PLAY TO SUCCEED
Each player is dealt an Adventure Card and given a corresponding pawn before the game starts, designating him or her with a certain set of strengths. This game is designed so that instead of competing with other players, you work to find the treasures and find out how to best use each Adventurer's strengths through collaborative play. This stimulates problem-solving and strategy skills.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Water level marker, water meter, 58 playing cards, 24 island tiles, 6 pawns, 4 treasure figurines, rules of play, Gamewright catalog, and comment card.







FROM THE MANUFACTURER
It’s a great honor to introduce the latest creation by cooperative game master, Matt Leacock. There are so many things we love about this unique game: from the rich illustrations, to the collaborative nature of play, to the innovative set of rules, to the infinite possibilities generated by the tiles and cards. Don’t be surprised if your pulse starts pounding faster soon after you start playing – it’s a game that instantly generates an electrifying atmosphere of tension and excitement. Dare to discover Forbidden Island. Join a team of fearless adventurers on a do-or-die mission to capture four sacred treasures from the ruins of this perilous paradise. Your team will have to work together and make some pulse-pounding maneuvers, as the island will sink beneath every step. Race to collect the treasures and make a triumphant escape before you are swallowed into the watery abyss.

See more
